forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. Southwest wind 14 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 13 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
A gentle shroud of clouds drapes over Downtown San Francisco tonight, hinting at a night that feels softer than most. The temperate air, akin to the whispers of the ocean swell, rests around fifty-four degrees. A brisk southwest breeze, offering an invigorating nudge, dances with gusts that add a note of urgency to the otherwise calm evening. As the horizon wraps itself in silken shadows, the city seems to breathe in a slow rhythm, inviting quiet reflection or perhaps the company of a well-worn book in a cozy café.

Thursday dawns with the promise of sunshine, the clouds gradually lifting to reveal a canvas painted in mellow hues. Though the high temperature approaches sixty-five degrees, a typical San Francisco afternoon will see the heat retreat slightly, settling around sixty-three as the sun journeys across the sky. Another afternoon breeze, lively and bright, stirs the space between buildings, reminding wanderers of the city’s iconic charm. Dressing in layers remains wise—perhaps a light jacket over a comfortable shirt, perfect for embracing the city's capricious climate. As you navigate the streets, consider exploring lesser-known nooks of the neighborhood, seeking out a small gallery or a tucked-away farmers' market, where the pulse of local life continues undeterred by the changing weather.
